title: Senior Software Engineer React
description:
Join us as we pursue our innovative vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun and most meaningfully, to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!



Are you passionate about working on critical systems to create tangible customer impact? Would you like the opportunity to work at a growing company that is changing the way that information is used to support business decisions? If this resonates with you, we would love to speak with you.



Our team is a dynamic technology group with a mission to make data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. If you possess a passion for outstanding technology leadership and embrace the challenge of working on highly scalable systems that handle large volumes of data, this position is for you. We are building state-of-the art capabilities, data processing and search systems, support tools, security frameworks and automation instrumentation that will greatly impact how our customers successfully use data to improve their businesses performance, scalability, profitability, and market strategies.



Role

Participate in the complete software development cycle: Understand requirements, design, develop, test, automate and deploy software
Identify and resolve pre-production system bottlenecks and production issues
Engage in design and code reviews of the product, and enhance your knowledge of customers’ experiences to prevent future problems
Make code maintainable and the product diagnosable and serviceable
Participate in rotating on-call duties to diagnose and solve customer issues.
Own features from start to finish; Mentor junior engineers


Requirements

Strong fundamentals in software engineering: data structures and algorithms
You have very good JavaScript, CSS and HTML authoring skills.
You have created rich visualizations and UI/UX using ReactJS and Redux.
Experience with UI testing frameworks like Mocha, Chai, Jasmine, Jest, WebdriverIO
Experience in working on distributed systems like databases, distributed file systems, distributed concurrency control, consistency models, CAP theorem is an added plus.
Strong debugging and troubleshooting skills including the use of associated tools
Experience with developing CI/CD systems, test automation frameworks, 
Ability to document your work for the benefit of the team
Knowledge of REST, grpc or similar communication paradigms
Knowledge of public cloud services such as AWS, GCP, Azure 
Operational excellence: you think beyond feature delivery into how your code is serving customers in production


What we offer

A team of incredibly capable and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering to product management and customer support.
A stable, collaborative, and supportive work environment. We work in an open environment, work together to get things done, and adapt to the changing needs for the team. We keep it real by being open and honest. 
Balance. We want you to be successful outside of work too. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and commitment, and believe that balance helps cultivate a positive environment.
Fun. We are committed to having every employee want to give it their all, be respectful and a part of the family, and have a smile on their face while doing it.

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

title: Analityk/Analityczka Danych
description:
Jesteśmy największą w Polsce firmą mediowo-technologiczną. Dostarczamy wiarygodnych informacji i tworzymy usługi cyfrowe, którym można zaufać. Stawiamy na utalentowanych ludzi, zrównoważony rozwój oraz mądre użycie technologii. ortfolio mediów Ringier Axel Springer Polska obejmuje ponad 20 uznanych marek drukowanych i cyfrowych takich jak: Onet - największy portal informacyjny w Polsce, Fakt - największy polski dziennik oraz Sympatia - lider w internetowych serwisach randkowych w Polsce.

Co będzie należało do Twoich obowiązków:

👉Codzienne wsparcie w analizach ruchu i zachowań użytkowników
👉Wyszukiwanie insightów i tworzenie rekomendacji dla biznesu
👉Analityka efektywności wykorzystania naszych powierzchni reklamowych i działań marketingowych
👉Analiza ścieżek użytkownika w kanałach digital
👉Współpraca przy tworzeniu testów A/B oraz analiza ich wyników

👉Udział w projektach specjalnych poprawiających działania i procesy biznesowe na poziomie całej grupy

Czego oczekujemy?

👍Znajomość SQL i praktyczne doświadczenie z bazami danych
👍Min. 1 rok doświadczenia w obszarze analityki internetowej
👍Doświadczenie w wykorzystaniu w analityce Python’a lub R’a
👍Znajomość narzędzi do wizualizacji danych (np. Tableau, DataStudio)
👍Wysokie umiejętności interpretacji danych i przygotowywania rekomendacji biznesowych w oparciu o dane
👍Mile widziana znajomość AWS, Google Analytics

Oferujemy:

✔️ Smart work – elastyczny model pracy
✔️ Kafeteria benefitowa NAIS
✔️ Karta multisport i wyzwania sportowe
✔️Ubezpieczenie na życie dla ciebie i rodziny
✔️Prywatna opieka medyczna
✔️Legendarne imprezy
✔️Wsparcie psychologiczne i program well-being
✔️Platformy e-learningowe i szeroka oferta szkoleń
✔️ Kultura doceniania – People Awards i codzienne kudosy Praca z misją dla najbardziej rozpoznawalnych marek w Polsce
✔️ Nowoczesne biura — kolorowe, wygodne i ekologiczne

title: Principal Software Engineer
description:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!


Are you passionate about working on products that make a difference for your customers? Do you enjoy building large scale applications that are powered by huge data sets? Do you value working in an environment where you're empowered to make key technical decisions across a full stack of technologies? If so, a role on Splunk’s Security Analytics team would be a great fit for you.


Role


We are seeking a Principal Software Engineer to help lead, design, develop and deliver Splunk's User Behavior Analytics (UBA) security analytics solution that detects known and unknown security threats at scale using big data and machine learning techniques. Delivered on customer managed resources using Kubernetes and Spark to run innovative stream processing and machine learning algorithms in near real-time, UBA helps security analysts quickly identify and resolve threats.


We are a passionate team who care deeply about our customers and our teammates. In this role, you will work directly with Product Management, our Design Team, our Customers and other engineering teams to help derive the best experience for the customer. We have a lean process that focuses on empowering and serving our engineers as opposed to just directing them.


Responsibilities

Achieve a deep knowledge of our product architecture, usage patterns, and real world use-cases in order to better understand what solutions will bring value to our customers
Develop new product features, clarify and improve designs, and help put together a plan for how to make it happen (using Agile Methodologies)
Collaborate closely with Product Management and members of our team to design and create comprehensive end-to-end user workflows
Keep product quality top of mind by extensively using Continuous Integration/Continuous Development (CI/CD), testing technologies (unit, functional, performance), and best practices to ensure that the product is of high quality
Champion, coach and mentor others to solve problems in new and creative ways with the goal to maintain team efficiency and morale

Experience


Required:

Java and/or Scala programming experience
Familiarity with streaming and distributed computing technologies such as Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, Impala, Postgres
Exposure to working with container ecosystems (Docker, Kubernetes, Kubernetes Operator Framework)
Knowledge of distributed computing architectures and principles that solve for scalability, performance, redundancy and reliability
Experienced with an Agile DevOps engineering environment that effectively uses CI/CD pipelines such as GitLab
Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills, specifically a proven ability to effectively work with others within a dynamic environment
Ability to learn new technologies quickly and to understand a wide variety of technical challenges to be solved
12 years of related experience with a technical Bachelor’s degree; or equivalent practical experience; or 10 years and a technical Master’s degree; or a Ph.D. with 9 years experience; or equivalent practical experience

Desired:

Background in developing machine learning products for the Security market 
Experience in building an ETL pipeline with high-volume data ingestion
Examples of leadership and architecture design of big data and ML based platforms
Familiarity with Splunk’s Security products 


What We Offer You

A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies
A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering to product management and customer support
Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation
A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment

title: Cloud SecOps Engineer
description:
Cloud SecOps Engineer (80-100%)
Warsaw, Madrid | working from home up to 60% | Reference 4989


The Competence Center Corporate SaaS is responsible for the operation, integration and continuous optimization of various corporate services based on public cloud solutions. Cross-functional collaboration and agile principles provide end-to-end services with a strong focus on customer satisfaction. Your expert knowledge of cloud-based implementations and high motivation enable you to adapt our custom developed cloud services to the changing and challenging customer requirements. You will work as well on international projects and be involved in day-to-day operations as a security expert.
 What You Will Do
support application managers with the launch, adoption, and optimization of cloud solutions (SaaS)
design and implement public cloud services (IaaS/PaaS) by developing infrastructure as code to host applications
secure and maintain cloud infrastructure and operate applications in the public cloud in close cooperation with the application managers
consult and support application managers and internal customers in security related questions/topics, as well as contributed to internal projects as an SME
 What You Bring
degree in computer science, engineering, science, or similar field and working experience with cloud solutions (SaaS) 
hands-on experience working with public cloud services at enterprise-level, focusing on Azure 
experience and know-how for IT security around cloud services (IaaS/PaaS) and cloud solutions (SaaS)
open-minded and autonomous work attitude with a strong focus on quality and customer satisfaction 
very good verbal and written English skills, German is a plus 
  What We Offer

title: Senior Devops Engineer
description:
Join us as we pursue our innovative vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun and most meaningfully, to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

Are you passionate about working on critical systems to create tangible customer impact? Would you like the opportunity to work at a growing company that is changing the way that information is used to support business decisions? If this resonates with you, we would love to speak with you.

The Developer Platform Infrastructure organization develops robust and resilient platform solutions for building, testing and deploying Splunk's enterprise software. The teams are fast-paced, high-velocity, and use state-of-the-art technology. The focus is always on automation, solving complex challenges that span across multiple groups within Splunk, ensuring smooth and expedient services to Splunk users.
This is an incredible opportunity to utilize your existing system design, SaaS, cloud experience and drive the growth at Splunk.

Role

Lead/contribute to engineering efforts from design to implementation, solving complex technical challenges around scalability, reliability and resiliency.
Demonstrate service ownership and provide support to internal customers and stakeholders
Design and build advanced CI/CD infrastructure and pipelines; help teams debug and build projects and workflows
Develop tools and services that enable developers to quickly build and test software rapidly in a secure fashion
Mentor early career engineers provide technical and cultural guidance
Build a great customer experience for engineers using our Infrastructure
Provide self-service access for engineering teams to deploy, scale and access infrastructure
Participate in a regular on-call rotation in support of services owned by the team.

Requirements

CI/CD and tooling expertise. Cloud, container and virtualization experience. Innovating and scaling secure services on-prem and different cloud providers is a plus. You will use Kubernetes, Docker, UCP, AWS/GCP, Jenkins, Gitlab, Ansible.
Data structures and algorithms. A solid grasp of data structures, algorithms, and RESTful APIs.
Observability infrastructure expertise to ensure 24/7 operational excellence and data driven decision making.
Ability to work with multiple programming languages. We have code in several languages, ranging from Go to Python.
BS/MS degree in EE or CS or a related technical field or 5+ years of progressive experience.
Desire to learn and adapt. You will constantly be learning new areas and new technologies.
Passion. Our customers are passionate about Splunk, and we want the same from our engineers. We want you to be excited and have utmost ownership of your projects



What we offer

Opportunities to develop and grow as an engineer. We are always expanding into new areas, working with open-source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.
A team of incredibly capable and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering to product management and customer support.
Breadth and depth. The team works in a broad problem domain where there are always new challenges or areas to solve.
Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and opportunities. We also believe that mentors help both sides of the equation.
Fun. We have frequent group outings and team building events. We are committed to having every employee want to give it their all, be respectful and a part of the family, and have a smile on their face while doing it.

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
description:
Join us as we pursue our innovative vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun and most meaningfully, to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

What we’re looking for
We are looking for a Senior Site Reliability Engineer to help design and build the next generation of our large scale Cloud offering. You will be developing the internal platform and supporting the implementation of Splunk’s own Enterprise product within Splunk, used extensively within the company, and one of the largest scale systems of its size in the world.



What you provide

Familiarity with cloud environments. We operate in AWS, GCP, and more in future. You are familiar with at least one of these, and willing to learn the rest.
Familiarity with SRE and devops tooling. You are familiar with terraform, puppet, and git, and have used them for managing production infrastructure.
Familiarity with programming languages. You are comfortable with either Python or Go, and willing to learn the other. If you already know both, that’s great!
Familiarity with observability systems and tools. You have experience with log management solutions like Splunk Enterprise or Elastic or similar. You also have experience with metrics management systems like Prometheus or SignalFX or similar. You don’t need to already know the Splunk products, but you must be willing to learn.
Desire to learn and adapt. Our agile team has a lot of projects going on at once, and you'll have the opportunity to learn to navigate the code and features. You'll constantly be learning new areas and new technologies.
Passion. Our customers are passionate about Splunk, and we want the same from our engineers. We want you to actively own your work and be excited about your projects.
Drive for automation. You constantly consider, "How can I automate this manual process?" You will use Terraform to manage various cloud infrastructure resources. An understanding of Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) and declarative configuration languages as preferred.
Knowledge of technical excellence. You know continuous delivery, automated testing, security methodologies, system performance, and disaster recovery concepts.
Operational excellence. Data excites you and you make decisions based on numbers rather than assumptions. If an issue arises, you strive to be alerted before our customers notice.
Keeping calm and carrying on. Capable in navigating through a product outage, skilled in identifying performance bottlenecks, spotting anomalous system behavior, and figuring out the root cause of incidents.
Linux proficiency. Excited to apply system administration experience and comfort in developing or creatively addressing challenges via a linux/unix console.
Self-sufficiency. You work independently, learn quickly, and build relationships with people easily. You do not need to have a manager supervising you closely in your day to day work, and can independently lead a project to success.
Though not required, it is also awesome if you have built scalable secure services on cloud providers such as AWS, and have some Splunk expertise.


What we provide

Opportunities to develop and grow as an engineer. We are always expanding into new areas, working with open-source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.
A team of incredibly capable and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering to product management and customer support.
Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe that mentors help both sides of the equation.
A stable, collaborative, and supportive work environment. We work in an open environment, work together to get things done, and adapt to the changing needs for the team.
Balance. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and commitment, and believe that balance helps cultivate a positive environment.

We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey.


UBA helps security analysts quickly identify and resolve threats; delivered on customer managed resources using Kubernetes and Spark to run innovative stream processing and machine learning algorithms in near real-time.


This is an exciting engineering leadership role to lead and develop a team of passionate engineers. This team will deliver product features and enhancements as well as fixes and solutions to Splunk’s customers with rapid turn-around time, raising customer satisfaction. We are looking for a leader that has both strong technical abilities and experience building relationships with the Customer Success, Support, and the Field organization. Furthermore, the manager will play a vital role in product innovation by working closely with product management and other engineering teams to build and enhance the Splunk product in terms of new features with quality, diagnosability, and usability at the forefront.


As a leader in the UBA Engineering group, you'll also be deeply involved in roadmap planning, structuring our organization, and collaborating with a large network of software and security professionals. Splunk's teams are distributed in multiple locations; the right candidate will need to have excellent communication and leadership skills which transcend the geographic divides.


What We Offer You:

A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.
A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support.
Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.
A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment.

Responsibilities:

Lead a team of high skilled frontend and backend engineers and serve as coach, mentor and technical adviser.
Working closely with the rest of the leadership and product management team on product strategy and roadmap refinement with the customer first thinking.
Passionate about good engineering practices, new technologies, and improving processes, and a consistent record of mentoring and coaching team members.
Lead the creation of features and product releases by being closely involved with the product development, design, and review.
Experience developing and delivering scalable enterprise products.
CI/CD is a top priority for us as we further mature our development model. A successful manager will champion code quality among the team by actively participating in code reviews, test plan development, and holding ourselves accountable for writing appropriate automated tests.
Work closely with developers and architects on technical decisions throughout the development lifecycle.
Work with other team leads from across the product organization on inter-area projects, help identify the critical paths of components, and resolve dependencies.
Hold regular 1:1s with direct reports, help them navigate challenges, and coach them for their career development.
Plan & implement strategies to help team align with the organizational goals.

Requirements:

5+ years of experience in product engineering leadership roles directly managing highly technical engineers.
Able to build teams by attracting & retaining talent in a fiercely competitive environment.

Nice to have skills

Experience working in or leading engineering teams distributed across geographies and timezones.

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which you are applying.

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Information Systems are a key aspect of the Spark strategy, a hands-on Infrastructure Engineer is imperative in a multi-tiered approach to our infrastructure that supports the business.
 The Infrastructure Engineer will be responsible for providing 3rd line support to the business working closely with the VP of Information Systems.  The Infrastructure Engineer will work closely with the VP in order to help deliver key projects, to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support cost-effective technology solutions for all aspects of the organisation. The candidate will work with the DevTeam to support and help with the development of the Hosting platform, particularly with the move to a Kubernetes architecture.
 The candidate should be able to demonstrate practical experience in a similar role.
 This role is predominantly a working-from-home role but there will be requirements to visit the office in Warsaw as the role requires.
 There may also be a requirement to travel abroad to different sites as needed. 

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
System/Application/Network Support
  Own the build, configuration and ongoing support of IT physical and cloud Infrastructure platforms including network, servers, storage, end user compute and security solutions.
Working closely with the VP of IS to assist in the design of a secure, robust, scalable and high performing cloud and office network infrastructure.
Maintenance of technical documentation to support project delivery and the ongoing operation of our infrastructure services.
Effective monitoring of infrastructure and network services to ensure business systems availability and performance.
Dealing with infrastructure and network support tickets ensuring timely resolution in line with business requirements.
ISO compliance experience and implementation.

Qualifications and Skills
The desired qualifications and skills of the Infrastructure Engineer are:
  3+ years experience in implementing and supporting infrastructure.
Azure and AWS build and administration experience with an understanding of security layers like VPCs/NACLs, Security Groups, IAM roles, etc
Microsoft Windows Server
Linux OS
Server and application configuration management experience including patch management
PowerShell scripting
PRTG management
Azure AD configuration and administration
Cisco Networking - LAN Switching, WLAN (Fortinet),
Fortinet Firewall administration
Native level fluency in written and spoken English

Operational 
Support the Dev Team with DevOps services and knowledge, participate in the move to Kubernetes.
Dealing with hardware and infrastructure support queries and issues assigned to the Infrastructure Engineer from the central service desk

title: ETL Developer
description:
WHO WE ARE

Hi! We are Erbis, a full-cycle development team building innovative solutions to help entrepreneurs and enterprises change the world for the better.

We are looking for an experienced and driven database engineer to join the team building and managing the data infrastructure necessary to make education a more data-informed industry. This individual will be a critical contributor to a fast-growing, early-stage education technology business and will have the unique benefit of joining a supportive team of experienced professionals on the ground level. Individual will support and maintain complex data storage systems and will be responsible for all aspects of development, performance tuning and monitoring.

OUR CLIENT

US-based data-driven business that serves colleges and universities. They help educational institutions drive their success with transparency of data, both across departments on campus and across the higher education marketplace. Our client leverage real-time student record-level data to visualize opportunities and provide analytics that highlight areas for improvement.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Leverage analytic and technical skills to support ingestion and normalization of data from colleges and universities, ultimately making large and complex data sets more usable for our campus partners
Assist with software deployment and management of the technical infrastructure
Support ETL processes to load data to Azure SQL and Azure Data Lake utilizing
Utilize SQL Data Tools to build ETL processes and solutions
Create Azure Databricks notebooks for ETL/ELT flow in modern DWH
Support and enhance business intelligence development efforts by translating business needs to technical specifications
Create technical documentation for databases to assist other team members and aid in onboarding new employees
Collaborate with the data and analytics team as well as the client service team in support of our partners
Uphold the highest standards for data quality and integrity

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology or related field or a database certification
Experience developing in the Microsoft Azure cloud computing platform including Azure Data Factory (ADF), Data Bricks, and Azure Functions
Experience developing in Azure SQL
Experience working with data in Python
Extensive experience testing and troubleshooting to solve complex technical problems
Impressive interpersonal and verbal communication skills
Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks appropriately

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience working with large databases and developing data warehouses
Experience working with Data Bricks notebooks for automated data processing
Experience designing and developing dimensional models
Excellent customer relationship skills

WE HAVE SOME PERKS & BENEFITS. YOU CAN:

Choose the comfortable working mode with the hybrid working model
Get recharge with a paid PTO
Gain new skills with 10% of the time available for education
Join company parties, cultural, and sports events
Participate in our Bring Your Own Device Program

title: Senior Backend Engineer (Remote)
description:
We are looking for an experienced (6+ years) Node.js engineer with a track record of delivering good products, a passion for sharing knowledge and who enjoys a collaborative and fast-paced environment.

What you will do
As a person, you are very hands-on and enjoy getting things done while understanding that we win as a team. As a senior, you take an active role in growing our team's capabilities both in terms of skills, best practices and architectural decisions.
We build our backend using reliable tools that our team knows and trusts, including Node.js, Express, Typescript, MySQL, ElasticSearch and Redis.

Working at ChurchDesk
Our customers are some of the largest and oldest institutions in the world. The church is changing to prepare for the future and we are here to help them. It's critical for them to improve how they work and stay connected to their members and communities.
We have been around for 10 years and have grown across Europe from a startup to an international business, but we still have a lot of work ahead of us. Join us to work on a big opportunity, have fun at work and develop both yourself and your career.

What we offer
We’re an international collaborative tech team of 8 people who genuinely enjoy working together to make ChurchDesk a better product. In this role, you will be able to make a big impact. We are low on ceremony and keep lean processes.
Great social environment. Annual company kick-off and team trips to ensure we get together as a full team on a quarterly basis.
6 weeks paid vacation and recommend everyone to take a 3-week well-earned summer break.
Our frontend stack is React and we welcome cross-team work.

ChurchDesk is not a religious company. We help develop and transform some of the largest institutions in the world with more than a billion members.

Job requirements
6 years of experience with software development and Node.js.
3 years of experience testing, maintaining or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.
Deep understanding of relational database systems, specifically MySQL.
Understanding NoSQL Datastores such as ElasticSearch, Redis and MongoDB is a plus.
Experience building scalable, performant, and modular solutions.
Clear and concise communication skills.
You have to be based in the EU. Alas, we're not set up to hire outside of the EU since we believe that it's imperative that we meet in person once in a while.
At least one year of remote experience is required if you prefer to work remotely.

We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey.


Role:


Our goal is to remove the barriers between data and action, and provide people with the access to informative, predictive, relevant, and actionable data via the Splunk platform. This team focuses on Splunk Application Management, who are integral in the adoption and successful use of Splunk’s platform.


We are looking for an extraordinary software engineer to drive the technical direction and implementation of the Splunk Cloud application management experiences. Excellent problem solving, collaboration and communication skills, both verbal and written.

A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.
A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, from engineering and QA to product management and customer support.
Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.
A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment.
An opportunity to see the positive impact of your work on real customers.

We value diversity at our company. title: Senior Software Engineer (Golang)
description:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable, and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun, and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!


Are you passionate about building software that makes a difference? Do you enjoy collaboration with a team of fun and smart creative people? Do you value an environment where you're empowered to make key technical decisions across a full stack of technologies? If so, a role on Splunk on Kubernetes (sok8s) team might be a great fit for you.


Role


As a Senior Software Engineer you'll be part of Splunk’s core cloud platform and responsible for designing and developing Kubernetes based service to manage the lifecycle of cloud connected applications in Splunk cloud and customer managed environments. You will be immersed in both microservices and core platforms as well as have exposure to the full portfolio of technology areas.


You are an expert in distributed computing, cloud native software architecture/development and efficient in-memory algorithms. Initiative, passion and commitment is your soft currency. You are excited to take on roles that provide new growth and learning opportunities. Finally, you enjoy working with highly collaborative teams and have fun doing your stuff!


What You’ll Do

Design and develop algorithms/code for Splunk Enterprise roadmap for Cloud.
Collaborate in a CI / CD development model for cloud native deployments.
Create high quality distributed design and code and maintain it in the cloud.
Analyze and improve performance, scalability and reliability.
Brainstorm and influence technical decision making for features and architecture turns.
Have fun and achieve your career goals.

8 years of related experience with a technical Bachelor’s degree; or equivalent practical experience;
Familiarity with working on Kubernetes Operator model, and Kubernetes APIs
Familiarity and experience with Microservices Architecture & AWS
Expert level experience building cloud microservices and distributed systems in golang.
Demonstrable foundation in data structures, algorithms and software design for cloud scale.
Experience with agile development models for cloud native architectures (Microservices, automated CICD, RESTful API’s SOA, etc) at cloud scale.
Prior development experience in networking protocol stacks (TCP/IP, HTTPx, DNS).
Familiarity and prior experience working with Kubernetes, dockers and AWS/GCP.

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

title: Security Architect
company_name: Standard Chartered GBS Sp. z o.o.
description:
Security Architect


THE ROLE RESPONSIBILIETIES:
Become a trusted advisor and subject matter expert (SME) on security architecture. provide deep architectural expertise on complex cloud and on-premises projects,  
Deliver workable risk/threat-driven solutions with cost/benefit analysis. 
Communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, provide guidance on proper architectural patterns. Identify and mitigate anti-patterns, redundancies, and duplications.  
Perform gap analysis for specific domains, identify gaps in existing capabilities, service maturity.  
Identify missing cybersecurity and cyber-resilience capabilities in alignment with changing business needs, threat land scape and technical requirements to increase the quality of the selected solutions also including topics such as products’ convergence over time and products decommissioning. 
Define and manage architecture artefacts including reference architecture documents, blueprints, technical and non-technical security requirements aligned to the corresponding strategic roadmap. 
Aligns architecture principles with our cybersecurity strategy, ensures alignment to roadmaps, cyber security, and resiliency standards as well as to our architectural framework.  
Responsible for security architectural design, realisation of the architecture in the solution implementation roadmap. 
Analyse market trends and threat landscape, provide meaningful insights, opportunities, and risks. 
Represent the architecture group in key internal service architecture governance forums.  
Work closely with your pears in the security architecture group, service and solution architects, engineers, project teams. 

OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE:
Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, preferably majoring in cybersecurity.    
3 and more years of experience in security architecture roles, leading complex architectural projects with multiple stakeholders, utilizing various security tools/technologies. 
2-3 years hands-on experience (coding in Java, JS, Python) ideally full stack development.
Proven threat modelling experience using STRIDE/MITRE/OWASP and/or other threat modelling methodologies for complex systems (ideally MITRE ATT&CK Defenders (MAD) Certified). 
1-2 years of experience in networking architecture and/or networking security architecture and/or AWS networking specialty certified / Cisco CCNP Security / etc. 
Deep technical skills with good understanding in cross-functional technologies (IAM, data protection, threat management, vuln management, etc.) ability to dive into technical engineering details. 
Experience in offensive tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), pen-testing / hacking background or (OSCP, CEH master) certified. 
Excellent communication skills, ability to explain complex topics to both technical and non-technical audiences. Proven ability to influence relevant stakeholders and decision makers. 
Excellent organisational skills, ability to manage deadlines and effectively prioritise multiple projects.

Role Specific Technical Competencies:
Experience working in security architecture / engineering roles for financial institutes.
Relevant cybersecurity certifications (AWS/Google/Microsoft Certified Security specialist, architect, GDSA, SANS GIAC, CISSP-ISSAP).
AWS solutions architect professional certified and 3 years of experience in AWS environment or 5 hands-on years equivalent experience in AWS solution architecture.
In depth understanding of threat-attack methodologies (STRIDE, DREAD, OWASP, Attack trees, MITRE ATT&CK, etc.) and corresponding mitigations in an enterprise environment.
Experience with cybersecurity frameworks e.g., NIST cybersecurity framework, NIST 800-53v5, NIST 800-37, ISO 27xxx, etc.
Knowledge of offensive tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), ideally completed training and/or certifications (OSCP, CEH, Pentest+, etc.)

YOU WILL BE OFFERED:
Career development in a fast-growing company with a clear business strategy
Opportunity to expand international experience and build global professional relations
Competitive benefits package (incl. health & life insurance, pension plan, meal & sports cards)
3 days of paid volunteering leave our employees can use to support the cause of their choice
Convenient location (next to Rondo Daszyńskiego) with subway, tram and bus lines and comfortable office space with chillout areas, free coffee/tea & fruit supply
26 days of leave per year for all the employees

About Standard Chartered 
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents. And we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.

Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity,  together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:
Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
Be better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term

Recruitment assessments - some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.

As an Engineer on Developer Experience Team, you will be at the heart of Splunk’s engineering process building software that empowers engineering teams to develop and deliver high quality products quickly. We are focused on solving the hardest, most interesting challenges of developing and testing software at scale without sacrificing stability, quality, velocity or code health. We are looking for candidates who share a passion for building scalable and robust. Frameworks and services for our CI/CD pipeline which enable and help developers deliver quality software to customers quickly.

Create frameworks and services that will improve developer velocity and productivity.
Develop a paved road for code validation tools and services to help shift left the testing of the product.
Create and maintain a developer portal that is a highly extensible platform powered by a service catalog.

title: Engineering Team Lead (Offer&Hire Team)
description:
🚀 SmartRecruiters is building an operating system (SaaS product hosted on AWS and GCP) for recruiting and is on a mission to connect people with jobs at scale. The company is growing quickly and recently hit the 1.5 billion dollar valuation. The system is used by over 4,000 companies, including employees at LinkedIn, McDonald's, CD Bosch, Allegro, and many more! Our engineering team solves one of the most important problems of the modern economy - connecting great people with great jobs. We supported over 100M job seekers to date! 💪 🚀 

Our system is composed of hundreds of independent services (each sitting on Docker, orchestrated by Kubernetes). We build most of our services in Java and do over 2000 production deployments per month, maintaining an uptime of 99.98. We are looking for an Engineering Team Lead to help us build the next chapter of that vision. 

🚀 Our engineering organization is built with small, cross-functional teams where Engineers, Product Managers, and Product Designers work side by side to solve customer problems. Each team owns a part of our business and takes care of it, from feature ideas to usage analysis.

Offer & Hire Team believes every organization should be able to allow their applicants to safely control data consent, be able to engage their candidates with a smooth offering experience, and be able to ensure their candidates' hire is efficiently administered.

We are looking for an experienced engineer that would like to grow as a people leader. Engineering Team Leads at SmartRecruiters spend around 50% of their time managing people and collaborating with stakeholders and 50% of their time designing and building products. title: Senior Python Developer (Analytics)
description:
Aterian (NASDAQ: ATER) is a rapidly growing technology-enabled consumer products company that uses machine learning, natural language processing, and data analytics to design, develop, market, and sell products through online retail channels (e.g., Amazon, Walmart, etc). Aterian was founded on the premise that if a company selling consumer packaged goods was founded today, it would apply artificial intelligence and machine learning, the synthesis of massive quantities of data, and the use of social proof to validate high caliber product offerings as opposed to over-reliance on brand value and other traditional marketing tactics.

About our project:
As a member of the Aterian team, you will be working on one of our proprietary products. We sell on various e-commerce platforms, including being one of the largest sellers on Amazon, and our system for managing sales channels is automated, offering services such as fulfillment and logistics, forecasting demand, optimizing marketing, pricing and market research, as well as utilizing affiliate platforms.
 To achieve all this, we need team members ready to dive in and help us grow. That’s where you come in.
  What we use (you don’t need to know everything on the list, but it helps):
⦿ Python
⦿ PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, Spark, Redis
⦿ Github, Jira, Azure
⦿ Linux

What we need you to have:
⦿ A minimum of 3-6 years of professional experience in developing production-grade systems using Python and Flask or similar technologies
⦿ An understanding of analytics design patterns and data pipelines
⦿ Proficiency in SQL
⦿ Understanding of OOP concepts
⦿ Experience in effectively communicating with stakeholders and translating business requirements into analytical code
⦿ Proficiency in spoken and written English
⦿ Experience in a big-data environment, with proficiency in developing against NoSQL databases such as ElasticSearch, MongoDB, and Cassandra is an added advantage
⦿ Experience in building applications utilizing Apache Spark is an added advantage
⦿ Experience in developing using .NET is an added advantage
⦿ Experience in ReactJS/Frontend development is an added advantage.

Personality Traits we're chasing:
⦿ Teacher - loves to share knowledge with the team, never stops learning new things
⦿ Detail-oriented - pays attention to detail and is able to ensure high quality results
⦿ Self-motivated - is able to motivate themselves and take initiative when needed
⦿ Critical Thinker - takes a scientific approach to problems by questioning, identifying patterns and utilizing critical thinking to find solutions.

What we're offering:
⦿ Salary in range of 4000 USD - 6700 USD
⦿ Macbook M1 Pro
⦿ 4+ weeks of paid vacation (depends on performance)
⦿ All your national or religious holidays are off work
⦿ Paid sick leave
⦿ Flexible working times
⦿ 2000 USD per year as Education Budget (after first 6 months of work)
⦿ Work fully remotely or from our office in Cracow

Recruitment process:
There are 2 steps in our recruitment process. 
After reviewing and accepting your CV we'll invite you to two meetings:
⦿ First Interview - 120 minutes long Google Meet call. We will discuss technical patterns, infrastructure, architecture, OOPs and also conduct a coding session with live performance optimization. You must be able to share your screen and be prepared to run some code.
⦿ Second Interview - up to 30 minutes long Google Meet call. We will discuss your soft skills, check your team-fit and talk in English.
We don't like to stretch the process so expect those calls to be performed in a timespan of 48h each.

title: Release Engineer
description:
At SmartBear, we deliver the complete visibility developers need to make each release better than the last. Our award winning and industry favorite tools TestComplete, Swagger, Cucumber, ReadyAPI, Zephyr and BugSnag are trusted by over 16 million developers, testers, and software engineers at 32,000+ organizations – including world-renowned innovators like Adobe, JetBlue, FedEx, and Microsoft.  

                                                                             Release Engineer 

                                                                                 BugSnag 

You’ll be writing code that runs when the app is crashing around it! 
Working in a team of open-source engineers: maintaining and improving our error monitoring SDKs on GitHub 
Broad technology stack, including: JavaScript, iOS, Android, React Native, Flutter, Unreal Engine, Python, Ruby, Go and Java  

About the product:  
BugSnag is the trusted software stability "command center" for over 5,000 engineering teams worldwide, including Airbnb, Slack, Pinterest, Docker, EA and Microsoft. We process over 1 billion crash reports daily from 85,000 applications, and empower our customers to make data-driven decisions on when to focus on building new features, or when to fix bugs. 

Go to our product page if you want to know more about BugSnag.  

You can even have a free trial to check it out 😊   

About the role  
BugSnag is a cross-platform tool with an open-source crash reporting library maintained by us in over 50 different platforms. We are looking for a Release Engineer who will be responsible for collating the changes made by our engineers – as well as community contributors – and publishing releases into the many artifact repositories for our customers to use.

You will work alongside a team of experienced SDK engineers to ensure that the releases contain all the expected changes. You will follow and maintain playbooks for building, smoke testing and releasing each artifact, whilst looking for opportunities to streamline and automate the process.

You will work in a sub-team alongside CI engineers, helping to expand our Continuous Delivery and be involved in our wider automation programme

About you 
You should have a keen eye for detail and methodical approach to ensure releases are of a consistently high standard: following procedures precisely and looking for unexpected results.

Good communication skills are essential – both the ability to discuss the content of releases and flag up issues with our engineers; and also to write formal, high-quality release notes.

We are looking for someone who relishes taking on technical challenges across a wide range of server, mobile and browser environments. You are interested in new techniques and technologies that could be used to drive forwards the automation and standardisation of our build processes.

We expect you will have:  
At least 2 years' experience in software engineering or DevOps
Competence in at least one programming language
An interest in build automation and CI/CD technologies

title: UX Writer
description:
We are the Polish branch of the BOLD group, building the largest career websites in the world since 2005 with our colleagues in San Francisco, Puerto Rico, and India. Our products, intended to help people find and kick-start their dream careers, draw in over 20,000,000 visitors a month and have been featured in The Guardian, Forbes, and The Financial Times.

We're in the business of making a positive difference—and now, you can join us in helping millions of job seekers change their careers and their lives for the better.

We need your help to optimize our products using UX methods. We are opening a new role to cover product processes from the beginning.

This is an ideal opportunity for UX Writers who want to deepen their knowledge and gain experience under the guidance of an experienced design team.

You will have the opportunity to participate in developing the product at all stages and deliver impactful insights for the Product team. After a few weeks of onboarding, you can start working on your research and hypotheses to work on them with experienced product teams.

How do we work?
We have regular team meetings.
Our point of reference is individual & team OKRTs (Objectives, Key Results, Tasks), which we plan every quarter.
We regularly meet with the team leader to discuss progress, plans, and development opportunities - this is the time for you!
Every 6 months, during the performance review, we discuss the two previous quarters. We have the opportunity to evaluate not only our work, but also the work of our leader.

Would you like to learn more about the Product Team? Check out our team's website.

You will learn how to:
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to create cohesive, user-focused product experiences.
Use user research insights to inform content decisions and create content that meets user needs.
Write clear, concise, and engaging copy that guides users through product experiences.
Create and maintain a style guide that ensures consistency of language and tone across all product touchpoints.
Advocate for the user and ensure that content is inclusive, accessible, and easy to understand for all users.

Requirements

Your responsibilities will include:
Designing the user experience using language, composing and modifying digital product interface content.
Coordinating with various stakeholders in the design process - including managers, designers, and researchers - to develop the content design.
Expanding and updating the language style guide.
Participating in usability studies, especially in terms of the language used in the app.
You ensure linguistic correctness and text coherence in the spirit of plain language principles.
Analyzing the market and competition in terms of language.

You’ll be a perfect fit if you have:
Prior work experience in a role that requires creating or editing texts.
Knowledge in fields such as UX writing, content design, plain language, and user-centered design.
The ability to communicate complex ideas in a simple, easy-to-understand way.
Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills focusing on grammar, punctuation, and spelling.
Knowledge of English and Polish (at least one at a native level).

Nice to haves:
Background in writing for mobile and web applications.
Knowledge of SEO and SEM best practices and the ability to apply them to content creation.
Experience with internationalization and localization processes.
Familiarity with user research and the ability to synthesize research findings into actionable insights.

Technologies/tools we use (don’t worry, we can teach you how to use them properly):
Figma - our primary tool, embedded in our DNA.
FigJam - Great ideas need great boards to work on them.
TryMata - for the unmoderated and moderated user testing longest sessions with users.
UsabilityHub - For impression tests and much more research features.
Axure - for testing the most advanced mockups and ideas.
Miro - our forge of ideas, workshops or flexible tracking.
HotJar - yes, but not for recordings :D.
FullStory - yeah, this is a good tool for analysing the user behaviour.
Mixpanel - the most powerful analytical tool on the market.
AP Experiments! - our powerful tool for A/B Testing. We love to experiment!
Google Analytics - to extend our knowledge about SEM and SEO.
Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence) - for tracking and documentation purposes.
Slack - without it, our communication would not be easy.
A lot of brain and empathy to discover our users’ needs.
Pencil and paper :).

What do we offer?
Flexible working hours - we have no problem if you prefer to work early in the morning or start work at noon - you decide for yourself. We work the way we want to achieve the best results.
Remote work - we are open to full remote candidates (from Poland). We also have office space in central Warsaw if you prefer to work on-site.
Equipment and Internet Program - the company reimburses the Internet expenses and one-time equipment purchases to make your work comfortable when we work remotely (in addition to a laptop and necessary accessories we provide all employees with by default).
Language Classes - organized by an external language school (in one of the following: English, German, Polish, Spanish, French, or Italian).
Wellness and Mental Care Programs (Yoga classes and a dedicated online platform).
Private healthcare (Medicover) and Multisport Card (the company fully refunds both single packages).
Udemy Business platform - unlimited access to 5,500+ courses.
By clicking "Apply" I express my consent to processing my personal data included in my job offer by Bold PL sp. z o.o. with its registered office in Warsaw, 00-032, ul. Przeskok 2 for recruitment purposes.

title: Software Support Engineer
description:
The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without.


Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.


We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?


The team


XM Discover provides a deep understanding of customers and employees by evaluating the actual words they use. The industry's leading AI-powered speech and text analytics engine analyzes all feedback and conversations at scale to reveal topics, perception of effort, emotion, empathy, sentiment, reasons for actions, intent and more. Insights from XM Discover are used to build a more holistic experience management (XM) strategy and stronger relationships with employees and customers as a result.


As a member of the XM Discover Platform scrum development team, you will be collaborating with other progressive engineers to  bring our software to the next levels of scalability, performance, security, and functionality.  This stack processes very large amounts of data using a variety of open-source technologies such as Java, Elastic, Kafka, Spring, Docker, Kubernetes, Postgres, Jenkins, Ansible, and others.  In this role there is lots of opportunity for growth - you will start with responsibility for both story-level and epic-level work, and broaden out from there.  As with all of our engineering roles, you will have influence on design and implementation and will be able to both mentor and be mentored.


The challenge:


As a Support Engineer at Qualtrics, you will be working with customer support as a part of the engineering team to address issues reported by customers and help them realize the full potential of the system. You will:


Triage and analyze customer-reported issues
Investigate application code and application logs to identify root causes
Implement fixes or provide necessary information to application engineers
Design and implement tools and reports that will speed up the resolution
Use existing tools and reports
Cooperate with Engineering, Customer Success, Customer Support  and Product Management teams, both locally and internationally
Identify trends in application quality and performance
Implement and monitor alerts based on quality and performance trends
  Skills required:


Ability to read code (like Java, Node, Go)
Ability to read application logs
Familiarity with one of the scripting languages (Bash, Python, Perl or other)
Ability to write SQL queries and execute common DB operations (extracts, mass delete etc)
Experience in diagnosing customer production issues
Experience building and/or managing software deployment pipelines (CI/CD)
Excellent English communication skills, written and spoken
Analytical thinking
Proactive approach to issues and trends 

Experience:


Bachelor’s degree - STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics)
Experience in support engineering including developing scripts and software
  What differentiates us from other companies:


Work-life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours.
We take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.
On top of the standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office.
We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Come create the technology that helps the world act together
Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world. 
We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

The team you’ll be part of
We are currently the largest institution of research and development in the ICT sector in Poland, successively growing and still looking for new talents. DevOps Specialist is one of the key positions in R&D Centers in Poland and at present, there are a few slightly different departments possibly interested in your experience. Find out which specific departments are currently recruiting for this position: Check our DevOps hiring teams

Below you will find some general information about our expectations in the DevOps Specialist positions.

What you will learn and contribute to
Designing, implementing and maintaining a build processes for multiple concurrent releases of embedded software
Prototyping concepts which proofs feasibility of complex solution proposals
leading development of technologies, tools and solutions
Proposing improvements across whole CI and automation environment
Writing scripts to automate build and deployment processes through build systems
Optimizing existing build jobs for simplicity and speed
Executing test suites in the continuous integration process
 Your skills and experience

title: Sr TechnicalCurriculum Developer/Trainer
description:
The Engineering Enablement & Education team is responsible for addressing the technical learning and knowledge needs of all engineers that develop Splunk products. The programs and solutions delivered by the team enable technical productivity and engineers’ growth to meet career goals. Our team’s goal is to build an extraordinary engineering organization through learning and knowledge sharing. Programs and solutions delivered by the team include technical onboarding, Tech Talks, internal technical documentation, code labs, technical training classes, and hackathons.


We’re seeking a Senior Technical Curriculum Developer/Trainer who will be a force multiplier to upskill thousands of engineers by analyzing, designing, implementing, and delivering extraordinary learning and knowledge sharing programs. This role is critical to help the team scale and will influence the shape of the knowledge sharing culture at the company.


What You’ll Be Doing:

Learn from our engineers to understand how Splunk products work and how our software is crafted, developed, tested, and deployed
Follow instructional design best practices to analyze knowledge gaps, assess training needs, and develop engaging live or self-paced learning programs
Create and maintain classroom content, labs, and codebases
Teach one or more technical classes
Assess the efficiency of learning programs and how they have impacted productivity and business objectives
Act as a consultant to stakeholders to provide the most effective ways to improve learning, technical documentation, and knowledge sharing within their organizations
Manage the delivery of training programs crafted by yourself or others
Develop or maintain tools that optimize training delivery and operations
Foster a culture of learning that promotes inclusion and diversity in our teams, interactions, and learning models

Who You Are and What Makes You Qualified:

Demonstrated ability to learn technical concepts
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with a diverse group of technical subject-matter experts to build, maintain and deliver technical content
Experience developing software in C++, Java, Python, Javascript, or similar programming languages
Experience in technical curriculum development, technical writing, or delivering live classroom training
Understanding of how software engineers learn and acquire new skills and knowledge
Experience with elearning or video editing tools such as Articulate Storyline, Rise, Camtasia, Vyond, Descript
Ability to assess knowledge gaps and learning needs through various data points
Knowledge of Learning Management Systems
Ability to optimally collaborate with geographically distributed teams

Education:


Minimum of 5+ years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree, preferably in computer science or a related field. 


Join us as we pursue our vision to make the world a place where data provide clarity, elevates discussion, and accelerates progress for everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey.

title: Specjalista ds. wsparcia IT
Programista Webowy
description:
CottonBee to pierwsza w Polsce internetowa drukarnia materiałów do szycia. Jesteśmy firmą tekstylną nowej generacji - od 2014 dostarczamy naszym klientom usługi druku cyfrowego na materiałach. Aktualnie ponad 80% produkcji trafia na rynki zagraniczne. Rozwijamy naszą autorską platformę e-commerce web-to-print zintegrowaną z autorskim systemem zarządzającym i automatyzującym proces produkcji.

W tym roku, podobnie jak w ubiegłym, znaleźliśmy się na liście Deloitte Technology Fast50 CE 2022jako jedna z 50 najszybciej rozwijających się firm technologicznych CEE. W 2021 Instytut Wzornictwa Przemysłowego wyróżnił nas nagrodą Dobry Wzór dla najlepiej zaprojektowanych produktów i usług w Polsce.

W związku z poszerzaniem zespołu developerskiego, poszukujemy osoby, która pomoże nam w wytwarzaniu najwyższej jakości oprogramowania i w rozbudowie naszej platformy.

Nasz zespół developerski jest w Krakowie, biznes i produkcja w Płocku, ale obecnie nie ma znaczenia skąd będziesz dla nas pracował/a.  Zależy nam jednak żebyś 2,3 razy w miesiącu był/a w stanie przyjechać do Krakowa, gdzie jest nasz CTO, żeby się spotkać, porozmawiać czy zrobić warsztaty z zespołem. Łatwiej pracować przy projektach i budować relacje znając się nie tylko z monitora. 🙂
 
👉 Chcielibyśmy, żebyś rozwijał/a się wspólnie z nami, dlatego interesuje nas stała, długofalowa współpraca. Jeżeli masz otwartą głowę, nie lubisz pracy od A do Z i chcesz mieć realny wpływ na sprawy, nad którymi pracujesz, to odezwij się do nas.

Czym będziesz zajmował/a się w CottonBee?

Współpracą z zespołem w zakresie definiowania rozwiązań dla wymagań biznesowych
Rozwojem systemu e-commerce i narzędzi wspomagających go
Dokumentowaniem wyników swojej pracy
Będziesz mieć wpływ na jakość produktu w całym cyklu wytwarzania oprogramowania.


Jakich technologii używamy?

W obrębie naszego systemu używamy kilku technologii. W przypadku aplikacji backendowych opieramy się o język ruby i framework Ruby on Rails oraz platformę .NET (Core). Jako silnik bazodanowy wykorzystujemy głównie PostgreSQL, w niewielkim zakresie korzystamy również z Redisa oraz MongoDB.
Jeśli chodzi o część frontendową to jako podstawę do tworzenia naszych aplikacji SPA wykorzystujemy Angulara.

Nasza infrastruktura oparta jest o usługi Microsoft Azure.

Kogo poszukujemy?

Programisty/ki, który/a pomoże rozwijać nam określone części naszego systemu - zgodnie ze swoją wiedzą i doświadczeniem. Oczekujemy zatem, że wykażesz się:

Znajomością przynajmniej jednej z technologii wykorzystywanej w naszym projekcie (patrz wyżej)
Znajomością systemów bazodanowych (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis) - w przypadku pracy z technologiami backendowymi.
Umiejętnością pracy z zewnętrznymi API oraz zasad budowania API (REST)
Wiedzą z zakresu technologii frontendowych (HTML, CSS, JS) - w przypadku pracy z technologiami frontentowymi
Chęcią rozwoju i nauki nowych technologii
Doskonałą samoorganizacją oraz szacowaniem pracochłonności swojej pracy
Dobrymi umiejętności komunikacyjnymi i umiejętnością pracy w zespole rozproszonym
Doświadczeniem w pracy z komercyjnym projektem

Jeśli to co napisaliśmy, wydaje Ci się ciekawe, ale nie masz doświadczenia zgodnego z opisem, masz natomiast wiedzę, jesteś zmotywowany i poszukujesz nowych wyzwań, to odezwij się do nas, chętnie porozmawiamy.

 Co możemy Ci zaoferować?

Ciekawą pracę w firmie, która realnie digitalizuje branżę tekstylną, ma ambicje i jest na dobrej drodze, żeby zostać jednym z liderów europejskich tej kategorii.
Samodzielne stanowisko ze wsparciem doświadczonego zespołu developerów
Możliwość rozwoju umiejętności, które już posiadasz oraz potencjalną możliwość nauki nowych technologii
Współpracę w oparciu o kontrakt B2B/staż/praktyki - w zależności od Twojego doświadczenia.
Elastyczne godziny (w ramach zdrowego rozsądku) i zdalny model współpracy (jednak od czasu do czasu chcielibyśmy mieć możliwość się spotkać w Krakowie).

 Zapraszamy do aplikowania i do zobaczenia!

title: Technical Consulting Engineer (LAN)
description:
What You’ll Do?
Work directly with customers to tackle complex technical issues
Diagnose, troubleshoot and resolve incidents related to Cisco products (mainly related to Cisco's Catalyst switches), services, and solutions
Be a member of an international team of trusted technical experts to worldwide Cisco customers and partners
Engage in cross-technology collaborations
Recreate customer technical problems within Cisco’s internal state-of-the-art labs
Be the first to lay hands on the latest and greatest cutting-edge technologies within the enterprise domain
Collaborate with the engineering teams to improve product quality by identifying and submitting software defects

What do we expect from you:
Knowledge of network and transport infrastructure protocols
Solid understanding of network infrastructure and network hardware (mainly enterprise-class routers & switches)
LAN and WAN production environment experience
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to understand the network, narrow down the issue and implement the fix
Ability to quickly adopt and learn new technologies and products using documentation and internal resources
Strong experience working with external customers. Good communication skills and ability to manage different stakeholders
Strong end-to-end ownership and drive toward resolving customers' problems.
Working independently, but comfortable in a team environment

We'll be very impressed if you can also show one of these:
Knowledge and experience in at least one of the network switching products: C2k/C3k/C4k/C6k/C9k/Industrial Ethernet Switches
Hold a current valid industry-recognizable accreditation
Basic knowledge of any programming language (preferably Python)

What’s in it for You?
Unique possibility to work fully remote from your location within the European Union
You will get targeted, structured training helping you to ramp up your knowledge
You will be given a mentor that will help you to get up to speed and grow in your first few months
You will join a team of great people who are experts in what they do while sharing an atmosphere where everyone supports each other and grows
Opportunity to shape yourself into an industry-leading networking expert with outstanding problem-solving and network troubleshooting skills
Unlimited access to any of Cisco’s hardware and software products from across the entire Cisco portfolio
Exceptional opportunities to grow - including access to resources, a variety of trainings, certification paths (e.g. CCIE/DevNet), rotations to different technology teams
Real impact on Cisco business by participating in internal projects focusing on automation, product development and adoption, process and tools optimization
You will be able to master communication and client engagement skills by being exposed to customers and stakeholders on many levels
Stable working hours: Monday – Friday 8am – 4pm Central European Time (with periodic weekend shifts on Saturday or Sunday 8am – 2pm – with additional monetary and a day off compensation).

Why Cisco?
#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
Cisco is not only an industry leader and the place to work for network engineers but also has unique and amazing work culture and year by year is on the top of the greatest places to work worldwide.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Fullstack)
description:
Our Analytics Center of Excellence (ACOE) harnesses our global healthcare insights, working closely with our clinical and therapeutic experts to power evidence-driven design, speed site activation and recruit the right patients, faster. We’re using big data and advanced analytics to derive insights that transform clinical development and bring new medicines to patients faster through successful trial delivery.
This multi-functional team is an innovation for our business, requiring entrepreneurial and independent thinking to build our capability. Unique and with a global view, this Center of Excellence is a chance to revolutionize the clinical research industry.
Involved in every stage of the product development lifecycle, you will work with data scientists to turn working prototypes into well-abstracted reusable services, build software to expose data science models to business users through responsive UIs, and support a culture of continuous improvement. As a software engineer, you will contribute to the architecture and shape coding standards.

Some of the things you'll be doing include…
Building analytic experiences powered by python backends that are highly performant on huge datasets.
Using the full capabilities of Javascript/React, and python to build a pioneering product.
Working to promote and ensure best practices and modern approaches are applied to challenging UI/UX problems.
Helping product managers and designers iteratively build and refine their plans.
Working with the entire team in a collaborative environment where all suggestions are encouraged, and all ideas thoughtfully considered.

Let's talk about you...
Experience (5+ years) building commercial software products as part of a team. We build using JavaScript (React), and python; you have professional experience with one or a combination of these.
Educated. A related technical degree is preferred.
You make an IMPACT. You take initiative and lead team members to turn ideas into real features, passionate about discussing use cases & user flows with product managers & designers and contributing ideas to those discussions.
You’re Front-End Focused. You love working proactively with product management and UX to refine and iterate on specifications as the product takes shape.
You’re Quality-Focused. You write code that’s well-tested, performs well, and fails gracefully.
You're Customer-Focused. You have opinions about how users will use the product, and what problem they might run into. Being interested and willing to dive into and understand customers' problems is both helpful and rewarding.
You’re Driven. You set challenging goals for yourself and push yourself to meet them; you have a passion for delivering high-quality quickly; and you enjoy working at a fast pace.
You’re Collaborative. You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others so we all can become better. You treat your colleagues with honesty, kindness, and respect and actively do your part to create a positive work environment.
You’re Humble. You are unafraid to ask questions when you don’t know the answer, and you approach disagreements with the possibility that you might be wrong.

We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward. Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!

Ogromna zmiana wiąże się z ogromną szansą. Tak więc, gdziekolwiek do nas dołączysz, będziesz cieszyć się swobodą marzeń i dostarczaniem lepszych, jaśniejszych rozwiązań oraz przestrzenią, aby rozwijać swoją karierę w nieskończenie różnych kierunkach.

DOŁĄCZ DO NAS!
